titlestmt.titleproper: K. Elaine Hoagland papers related to Oyster Creek. 1971-1982
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: K. Elaine Hoagland papers related to Oyster Creek.

bioghist.p: K. Elaine Hoagland is a researcher at the Center for Marine and Environmental Studies at Lehigh University in Bethlehem, Pennsylvania. In the 1970s and 1980s she worked in conjunction with the Wetlands Institute of Stone Harbor, New Jersey to research the boring and fouling organisms in the vicinity of the Oyster Creek Generating Station at Barnegat Bay, New Jersey.

scopecontent.p: This collection documents the federally funded research project conducted by Hoagland and the Wetlands Institute at the Oyster Creek Generating Station at Barnegat Bay, New Jersey. Materials include data sheets, reports, field notes, photos, slides, and x-ray photographs of sample panels. Specimens from this project are in the Academy's General Invertebrates Collection, Department of Malacology. The collection also includes records related to Hoagland's testimony as an expert witness in a legal matter involving the Oyster Creek Nuclear Generating Station.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
